cards.name: Time Machine
cards.text: {T}: Exile Time Machine and target nontoken creature you own. Return them to the battlefield at the beginning of your upkeep on your turn X in the next game you play with one of your opponents in this game, where X is the converted mana cost of the exiled creature.

foreignNames.name: Machine à remonter dans le temps

cards.originalText: {T}: Remove Time Machine and target nontoken creature you own from the game. Return both cards to play at the beginning of your upkeep on your turn X of the next game you play with the same opponent, where X is the removed creature's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Togglodyte
cards.text:
Togglodyte enters the battlefield turned on.
Whenever a player casts a spell, toggle Togglodyte's ON/OFF switch.
As long as Togglodyte is turned off, it can't attack or block, and prevent all damage it would deal.
cards.originalText:
Togglodyte comes into play turned on.
Whenever a player plays a spell, toggle Togglodyte's ON/OFF switch.
As long as Togglodyte is turned off, it can't attack or block, and all damage it would deal is prevented.

cards.name: Toy Boat
cards.text: Cumulative upkeep—Say "Toy Boat" quickly. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on Toy Boat, then sacrifice it unless you say "Toy Boat" once for each age counter on it—without pausing between or fumbling it.)
cards.originalText: Cumulative upkeep—Say "Toy Boat" quickly. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on Toy Boat, then sacrifice it unless you say "Toy Boat" once for each age counter on it—without pausing between or fumbling it.)

cards.name: Urza's Hot Tub
cards.text: {2}, Discard a card: Search your library for a card that shares a complete word in its name with the discarded card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: www.wizards.com/hottub
cards.originalText: {2}, Discard a card: Search your library for a card that shares a complete word in its name with the discarded card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Water Gun Balloon Game
cards.text:
As Water Gun Balloon Game enters the battlefield, each player puts a pop counter on a 0.
Whenever a player casts a spell, move that player's pop counter up 1.
Whenever a player's pop counter hits 5, that player creates a 5/5 pink Giant Teddy Bear creature token and resets all pop counters to 0.
cards.originalText:
As Water Gun Balloon Game comes into play, each player puts a pop counter on a 0.
Whenever a player plays a spell, move that player's pop counter up 1.
Whenever a player's pop counter hits 5, that player puts a 5/5 pink Giant Teddy Bear creature token into play and resets all pop counters to 0.

cards.name: World-Bottling Kit
cards.text: {5}, Sacrifice World-Bottling Kit: Choose a Magic set. Exile all permanents with that set's expansion symbol except for basic lands.
cards.flavor: YOUR AD HERE
cards.originalText: {5}, Sacrifice World-Bottling Kit: Choose a Magic set. Remove from the game all permanents with that set's expansion symbol except for basic lands.

cards.name: City of Ass
cards.text:
City of Ass enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add one and one-half mana of any one color.
cards.originalText:
City of Ass comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one and one-half mana of any one color to your mana pool.

cards.name: R&D's Secret Lair
cards.text:
Play cards as written. Ignore all errata.
{T}: Add {C}. (This mana is still added to your mana pool.)
cards.flavor:
"Let them complain. As long as the addictive ink is working, we can do anything we want."
PLAY AT YOUR OWN RISK
cards.originalText:
Play cards as written. Ignore all errata.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Super Secret Tech
cards.text:
Premium spells cost {1} less to cast.
Premium creatures get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: "Ooh . . . shiny"
cards.originalText:
All premium spells cost {1} less to play.
All premium creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: Charm School
cards.text:
As Charm School enters the battlefield, choose a color and balance Charm School on your head.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you by sources of the chosen color.
When Charm School falls off your head, sacrifice Charm School.
cards.originalText:
When Charm School comes into play, choose a color and balance Charm School on your head.
Prevent all damage to you of the chosen color.
If Charm School falls off your head, sacrifice Charm School.

cards.name: The Cheese Stands Alone
cards.text: When you control no permanents other than The Cheese Stands Alone and have no cards in hand, you win the game.
cards.flavor: The meat, on the other hand, has frequent visitors.
cards.originalText: If you control no cards in play other than The Cheese Stands Alone and have no cards in your hand, you win the game.

cards.name: Double Dip
cards.text: Choose another player. You gain 5 life. At the beginning of the first upkeep in your next game with that player, you gain 5 life.
cards.flavor: In a duel and taking a lickin' . . .
cards.originalText: Choose another player. Gain 5 life now and an additional 5 life at the beginning of the next game with that player.

cards.name: Get a Life
cards.text: Target player and each of that player's teammates exchange life totals.
cards.flavor: Gimme five! (Or whatever you got.)
cards.originalText: Target player and each of his or her teammates exchange life totals.

cards.name: I'm Rubber, You're Glue
cards.text:
When you speak in non-rhyming sentences, sacrifice I'm Rubber, You're Glue.
Say "I'm rubber, you're glue. Everything bounces off me and sticks to you": Change the target of target spell or ability that targets only you.
cards.originalText:
Speak only in rhyming sentences. If you do not, sacrifice I'm Rubber, You're Glue.
Say "I'm rubber, you're glue. Everything bounces off me and sticks to you": Target spell or ability, which targets only you, targets another player of your choice instead. (The new target must be legal.)

cards.name: Knight of the Hokey Pokey
cards.text:
First strike
{1}{W}, Do the Hokey Pokey: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal to Knight of the Hokey Pokey this turn. (To do the Hokey Pokey, put your right foot in. Put your right foot out. Put your right foot in. Shake it all about. Repeat this process for your left foot, right arm, left arm, and whole self.)
cards.flavor: That's what it's all about.
cards.originalText:
First strike
{1}{W}, Do the Hokey Pokey (Stand up, wiggle your butt, raise your hands above your head, and shake them wildly as you rotate 360 degrees): Prevent all damage to Knight of the Hokey Pokey from any one source.

cards.name: Lexivore
cards.text: Whenever Lexivore deals damage to a player, destroy target permanent other than Lexivore with the most lines of text in its text box. (If two or more cards are tied, target any one of them.)
cards.flavor:
Plucking the chicken
—Elvish expression meaning "flinging the monkey"
cards.originalText: If Lexivore damages any player, destroy target card in play, other than Lexivore, with the most lines of text in its text box. (If more than one card has the most lines of text, you choose which of those cards to destroy.)

cards.name: Look at Me, I'm the DCI
cards.text: Ban a card other than a basic land card for the rest of the match. (All cards with that name in any zone or sideboard are removed from the match.)
cards.flavor: Few understand the DCI's rigorous decision-making process.
cards.originalText: Ban one card, other than a basic land, for the remainder of the match. (For the remainder of the match, each player removes from the game all copies of that card in play or in any graveyard, hand, library, or sideboard.)

cards.name: Mesa Chicken
cards.text: Stand up, Flap your arms, Cluck like a chicken: Mesa Chicken gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Lo! lord of layers proudly comb-crested
Hero to hens father to feathers
Crowing sun-caller weaver of wattle
Elder to eggs."
—Rooster Saga
cards.originalText: Stand up, Flap your arms, Cluck like a chicken: Mesa Chicken gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Miss Demeanor
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
At the beginning of each other player's upkeep, you may compliment that player on their game play. If you don't, sacrifice Miss Demeanor.
cards.flavor: Even war can be civil.
cards.originalText:
Flying, first strike
During each other player's turn, compliment that player on his or her game play or sacrifice Miss Demeanor.

cards.name: Once More with Feeling
cards.text:
Exile all permanents and all cards from all graveyards. Each player shuffles their hand into their library, then draws seven cards. Each player's life total becomes 10. Exile Once More with Feeling.
DCI ruling — A deck can have only one card named Once More with Feeling.
cards.flavor: If yo  . . .  ted.
cards.originalText:
Remove Once More with Feeling from the game as well as all cards in play and in all graveyards. Each player shuffles his or her hand into her or his library, then draws seven cards. Each player's life total is set to 10.
DCI ruling: This card is restricted. (You cannot play with more than one in a deck.)

cards.name: Prismatic Wardrobe
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonland permanent that doesn't share a color with clothing worn by its controller.
cards.flavor:
"Spring in Dominaria means pastels!"
—Excerpt from Mage's Home Journal
cards.originalText: Destroy target card that does not share a color with clothing worn by its controller. You cannot choose an artifact or land card.

cards.name: Sex Appeal
cards.text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of targets, divided as you choose. If there are more people in the room of a different gender than you are as you cast this spell, prevent the next 6 damage this way instead.
cards.originalText: Prevent up to 3 damage total to any number of creatures and/or players. If there are more players in the room of the opposite sex, prevent up to 3 additional damage total to any number of creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Bureaucracy
cards.text:
Pursuant to subsection 3.1(4) of Richard's Rules of Order, at the beginning of the upkeep of each participant in this game of the Magic: The Gathering® trading card game (hereafter known as "PLAYER"), that PLAYER performs all actions in the sequence of previously added actions (hereafter known as "ACTION QUEUE"), in the order those actions were added, then adds another action to the end of the ACTION QUEUE. All actions must be simple physical or verbal actions that a player can perform while sitting in a chair, without jeopardizing the health and security of said PLAYER.
When any PLAYER does not perform all the prescribed actions in the correct order, sacrifice Bureaucracy and said PLAYER discards their complement of cards in hand (hereafter known as "HAND").
cards.originalText:
Pursuant to subsection 3.1(4) of Richard's Rules of Order, during the upkeep of each participant in this game of the Magic: The Gathering® trading card game (hereafter known as "PLAYER"), that PLAYER performs all actions in the sequence of previously added actions (hereafter known as "ACTION QUEUE"), in the order those actions were added, then adds another action to the end of the ACTION QUEUE. All actions must be simple physical or verbal actions that a player can perform while sitting in a chair, without jeopardizing the health and security of said PLAYER.
If any PLAYER does not perform all the prescribed actions in the correct order, sacrifice Bureaucracy and said PLAYER discards his or her complement of cards in hand (hereafter known as "HAND").

cards.name: Censorship
cards.text:
As Censorship enters the battlefield, choose a word.
Whenever a player says the chosen word, Censorship deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: Editor's note: There were no suitable flavor text submissions for this card.
cards.originalText:
When Censorship comes into play, choose a CENSORED word.
Whenever any CENSORED player says the chosen CENSORED word, Censorship deals 2 CENSORED damage to him or her.

cards.name: Checks and Balances
cards.text:
Cast this spell only if there are three or more players in the game.
Whenever a player casts a spell, each of that player's opponents may discard a card. If they do, counter that spell.
cards.originalText:
Whenever any spell is played, counter that spell if each player, other than the caster and his or her teammates, agrees to choose and discard a card. Those players must discard those cards after agreeing.
Checks and Balances may be played only in a game with three or more players.

cards.name: Chicken à la King
cards.text:
Whenever a 6 is rolled on a six-sided die, put a +1/+1 counter on each Chicken. (You may roll dice only when instructed to.)
Tap an untapped Chicken you control: Roll a six-sided die.
cards.flavor: During the Chicken Revolution, the king managed to keep his head while the others—well, just ran around.
cards.originalText:
Whenever a 6 is rolled on a six-sided die, put a +1/+1 counter on each Chicken in play. (You may roll dice only when a card instructs you to.)
Tap a Chicken you control: Roll a six-sided die.

cards.name: Clambassadors
cards.text: Whenever Clambassadors deals damage to a player, choose an artifact, creature, or land you control. That player gains control of that permanent.
cards.flavor: "Sorry we shelled your village—here's some gold."
cards.originalText: If Clambassadors damages any player, choose an artifact, creature, or land you control. That player gains control of that artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Clam-I-Am
cards.text: If you roll a 3 on a six-sided die, you may reroll that die.
cards.flavor:
The Clams down in Clamville
All scootered and skittled—
"The three is no more!"
The Clam fiddler fiddled.
cards.originalText: Whenever you roll a 3 on a six-sided die, you may reroll that die.

cards.name: Clam Session
cards.text:
As Clam Session enters the battlefield, choose a word.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sing at least six words of a song, at least one of which is the chosen word. If you don't, sacrifice Clam Session. You can't repeat a song.
cards.flavor: "Duke, Duke, Duke, Duke of Pearl . . . ."
cards.originalText:
When Clam Session comes into play, choose a word. 
During your upkeep, sing at least six words of a song, one of which must be the chosen word, or sacrifice Clam Session. You cannot repeat a song.

cards.name: Common Courtesy
cards.text:
Whenever a player casts a spell without asking your permission while casting it, counter that spell.
When a player asks you permission to cast a spell and you refuse, counter that spell and sacrifice Common Courtesy.
cards.flavor: "You didn't say the Magic word."
cards.originalText: Counter any spell unless its caster asks your permission to play that spell. If you refuse permission, Sacrifice Common Courtesy and counter the spell.

cards.name: Denied!
cards.text: Choose a card name, then target spell's controller reveals their hand. If a card with the chosen name is revealed this way, counter that spell.
cards.flavor: "Don't worry about it. It happens to every mage sooner or later."
cards.originalText: Play Denied only as any opponent casts target spell. Name a card, then look at all cards in that player's hand. If the named card is in the player's hand, counter target spell.

cards.name: Double Take
cards.text: Choose another player. You draw two cards. At the beginning of the first upkeep in your next game with that player, you draw two cards.
cards.flavor: "But next time we meet, . . ."
cards.originalText: Choose another player. Draw two cards now and draw an additional two cards at the beginning of the next game with that player.

cards.name: Fowl Play
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature is a Chicken with base power and toughness 1/1 and loses all abilities.
cards.flavor: "I feel like chicken tonight!"
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature loses all abilities and is a 1/1 creature that counts as a Chicken.

cards.name: Free-for-All
cards.text:
When Free-for-All enters the battlefield, exile all creatures face down.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses a card exiled with Free-for-All at random and puts it onto the battlefield.
When Free-for-All leaves the battlefield, put all cards exiled with it into their owners' graveyards.
cards.originalText:
When Free-for-All comes into play, set aside all creatures in play, face down.
During each player's upkeep, that player chooses a creature card at random from those set aside in this way and puts that creature into play under his or her control.
If Free-for-All leaves play, put each creature still set aside this way into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Psychic Network
cards.text: Each player plays with the top card of their library held against their forehead, revealed to each other player.
cards.originalText: Each player reveals the top card of his or her library to all other players by continuously holding it against his or her forehead. This does not allow a player to look at his or her own card. (That card still counts as the top card of your library. Whenever you draw a card, draw that one and replace it with the next card of your library.)

cards.name: Sorry
cards.text:
Before any player casts a spell with the same name as a card in any graveyard, that player may say "sorry." If they don't, any other player may say "sorry" as the spell is being cast. When another player says "sorry" this way, counter the spell.
Whenever a player says "sorry" at any other time, Sorry deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.originalText:
Before playing any spell, if a copy of that spell card is in any graveyard, the spell's caster may say "Sorry." If he or she does not, any other player may counter the spell by saying "Sorry" as it is cast.
If any player says "Sorry" at any other time, Sorry deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: B.F.M. (Big Furry Monster)
cards.text:
You must cast both B.F.M. cards to put
leaves the battlefield, sacrifice the other.
B.F.M. can't be blocked except by three or
cards.flavor:
"It was big. Really, really big. No, bigger
No, more. Look, we're talking krakens and
cards.originalText:
You must play both B.F.M. cards to put
leaves play, sacrifice the other.
B.F.M. can be blocked only by three or

cards.name: B.F.M. (Big Furry Monster)
cards.text:
You must cast both B.F.M. cards to put
leaves the battlefield, sacrifice the other.
B.F.M. can't be blocked except by three or
cards.flavor:
"It was big. Really, really big. No, bigger
No, more. Look, we're talking krakens and
cards.originalText:
You must play both B.F.M. cards to put
leaves play, sacrifice the other.
B.F.M. can be blocked only by three or

cards.name: B.F.M. (Big Furry Monster, Right Side)
cards.text:
B.F.M. onto the battlefield. If one B.F.M. card
more creatures.
cards.flavor:
than that. Even bigger. Keep going. More.
dreadnoughts for jewelry. It was big"
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight
cards.originalText:
B.F.M. into play. If either B.F.M. card
more creatures.

cards.name: B.F.M. (Big Furry Monster, Right Side)
cards.text:
B.F.M. onto the battlefield. If one B.F.M. card
more creatures.
cards.flavor:
than that. Even bigger. Keep going. More.
dreadnoughts for jewelry. It was big"
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight
cards.originalText:
B.F.M. into play. If either B.F.M. card
more creatures.

cards.name: Deadhead
cards.text: {0}: Return Deadhead from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only if an opponent isn't touching their hand (of cards).
cards.flavor: "I'm back from the Dead," the zombie moaned. "And they were far out, man."
cards.originalText: Put Deadhead into play. Use this ability only if any opponent loses contact with his or her hand of cards and only if Deadhead is in your graveyard.

cards.name: Double Cross
cards.text: Choose another player. Look at that player's hand and choose a card other than a basic land card from it. They discard that card. At the beginning of the first upkeep in your next game with that player, look at that player's hand and choose a card other than a basic land card from it. They discard that card.
cards.flavor: "You're in for a nasty butt-kickin'."
cards.originalText: Choose another player. Look at that player's hand and choose one of those cards other than a basic land. He or she discards that card. At the beginning of the next game with the player, look at the player's hand and choose one of those cards other than a basic land. He or she discards that card.

cards.name: Handcuffs
cards.text:
As Handcuffs enters the battlefield, choose a player.
When the chosen player's hands aren't touching each other, sacrifice Handcuffs and that player sacrifices three permanents.
cards.flavor:
"That was fun! Now me."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci
cards.originalText: Target player keeps both hands in contact with each other. If he or she does not, sacrifice Handcuffs and that player sacrifices three cards in play.

cards.name: Infernal Spawn of Evil
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
{1}{B}, Reveal Infernal Spawn of Evil from your hand, Say "It's coming": Infernal Spawn of Evil deals 1 damage to target opponent or planeswalker. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying, first strike
{1}{B}, Reveal Infernal Spawn of Evil from your hand, Say "It's coming": Infernal Spawn of Evil deals 1 damage to target opponent. Use this ability only during your upkeep and only once each upkeep.

cards.name: Jumbo Imp
cards.text:
Flying
As Jumbo Imp enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. Jumbo Imp enters the battlefield with a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the result.
At the beginning of your upkeep, roll a six-sided die and put a number of +1/+1 counters on Jumbo Imp equal to the result.
At the beginning of your end step, roll a six-sided die and remove a number of +1/+1 counters from Jumbo Imp equal to the result.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When you play Jumbo Imp, roll a six-sided die. Jumbo Imp comes into play with a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the die roll.
During your upkeep, roll a six-sided die and put on Jumbo Imp a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the die roll.
At the end of your turn, roll a six-sided die and remove from Jumbo Imp a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the die roll.

cards.name: Organ Harvest
cards.text: Your team may sacrifice any number of creatures. For each creature sacrificed this way, you add {B}{B}.
cards.flavor: "Lucy, you've got some spleenin' to do."
cards.originalText: You and your teammates may sacrifice any number of creatures. For each creature sacrificed in this way, add {B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Ow
cards.text: Whenever a creature deals damage to a player, that player may say "Ow" once for each permanent named Ow. If the player doesn't, Ow deals 1 damage to them.
cards.flavor: Have you ever noticed how some flavor text has no relevance whatsoever to the card it's on?
cards.originalText: Whenever any creature damages a player, for each Ow card in play, that player says "Ow" once or Ow deals 1 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Poultrygeist
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dies, you may roll a six-sided die. If you roll a 1, sacrifice Poultrygeist. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on Poultrygeist.
cards.flavor: Farmer Brown never ate eggs again.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature is put into any graveyard from play, you may roll a six-sided die. On a 1, sacrifice Poultrygeist. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on Poultrygeist.

cards.name: Temp of the Damned
cards.text:
As Temp of the Damned enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. Temp of the Damned enters the battlefield with a number of funk counters on it equal to the result.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a funk counter from Temp of the Damned. If you can't, sacrifice it.
cards.flavor: "Not the graveyard shift again!"
cards.originalText:
When you play Temp of the Damned, roll a six-sided die. Temp of the Damned comes into play with a number of funk counters on it equal to the die roll.
During your upkeep, remove a funk counter from Temp of the Damned or sacrifice Temp of the Damned.

cards.name: Volrath's Motion Sensor
cards.text:
Enchant player
As Volrath's Motion Sensor enters the battlefield, choose one of enchanted player's hands. That player balances Volrath's Motion Sensor on the back of that hand.
When Volrath's Motion Sensor falls off the chosen hand, sacrifice Volrath's Motion Sensor and enchanted player loses 3 life.
cards.originalText:
When Volrath's Motion Sensor comes into play, choose target hand controlled by an opponent. Enchanted player balances Volrath's Motion Sensor on the back of that hand.
If Volrath's Motion Sensor falls off the hand, sacrifice Volrath's Motion Sensor and that player loses 3 life.

cards.name: Burning Cinder Fury of Crimson Chaos Fire
cards.text:
Whenever any player taps a permanent, that player choose one of their opponents. The chosen player gains control of that permanent at the beginning of the next end step.
At the beginning of each player's end step, if that player didn't tap any nonland permanents that turn, Burning Cinder Fury of Crimson Chaos Fire deals 3 damage to that player.
cards.originalText:
Whenever any player taps a card, that player gives control of that card to an opponent at end of turn.
If a player does not tap any nonland cards during his or her turn, Burning Cinder Fury of Crimson Chaos Fire deals 3 damage to that player at end of turn.

cards.name: Chicken Egg
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. If you roll a 6, sacrifice Chicken Egg and create a 4/4 red Giant Chicken creature token.
cards.flavor:
"That's a lotta nuggets."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. On a 6, sacrifice Chicken Egg and put a Giant Chicken token into play. Treat this token as a 4/4 red creature that counts as a Chicken.

cards.name: Double Deal
cards.text: Choose another player. Double Deal deals 3 damage to that player. At the beginning of the first upkeep in your next game with that player, Double Deal deals 3 damage to the player.
cards.flavor: "I'm facing defeat, . . ."
cards.originalText: Choose another player. Double Deal deals 3 damage to that player now and deals an additional 3 damage to the player at the beginning of the next game with the player.

cards.name: Goblin Bookie
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Reflip any coin or reroll any die. (Activate this ability only any time it makes sense.)
cards.flavor:
"Glok loved bets! He'd sit in the bar all night an' laugh an' laugh. Hey—he still owes me."
—Squee, goblin casino hand
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}: Reflip any coin or reroll any die.

cards.name: Goblin Bowling Team
cards.text: If Goblin Bowling Team would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage plus the result of a six-sided die roll to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor: Flog was out of his league—this game wasn't up his alley, but the team couldn't spare him if he split.
cards.originalText: Whenever Goblin Bowling Team damages any creature or player, roll a six-sided die. Goblin Bowling Team deals to that creature or player additional damage equal to the die roll.

cards.name: Goblin Tutor
cards.text:
Roll a six-sided die. If you roll a 1, Goblin Tutor has no effect. Otherwise, search your library for the indicated card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
2 — A card named Goblin Tutor
3 — An enchantment card
4 — An artifact card
5 — A creature card
6 — An instant or sorcery card
cards.originalText:
Roll a six-sided die for Goblin Tutor. On a 1, Goblin Tutor has no effect. Otherwise, search your library for the indicated card, reveal that card to all players, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your library afterwards.
2 Any Goblin Tutor
3 Any enchantment
4 Any artifact
5 Any creature
6 Any sorcery, instant, or interrupt

cards.name: Hurloon Wrangler
cards.text: Denimwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player is wearing denim.)
cards.flavor: "Nothing comes between me and my Didgeridoos™."
cards.originalText: Denimwalk (If defending player is wearing any clothing made of denim, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Jalum Grifter
cards.text: {1}{R}, {T}: Shuffle Jalum Grifter and two lands you control face down. Target opponent chooses one of those cards. Turn the cards face up. If they chose Jalum Grifter, sacrifice it. Otherwise, destroy target permanent.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}, {T}: Put Jalum Grifter and two lands you control face down in front of target opponent after revealing each card to him or her. Then, rearrange the order of the three cards as often as you wish, keeping them on the table at all times. That opponent then chooses one of those cards. If a land is chosen, destroy target card in play. Otherwise, sacrifice Jalum Grifter.

cards.name: Krazy Kow
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. If you a roll a 1, sacrifice Krazy Kow and it deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: "I got your milk right here!"
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. On a 1, sacrifice Krazy Kow and it deals 3 damage to each creature and player.

cards.name: Landfill
cards.text: Choose a land type. Exile all lands you control of that type. Drop those cards, one at a time, onto the playing area from a height of at least one foot. Destroy each permanent completely covered by those cards. Then return the cards you dropped to the battlefield tapped.
cards.originalText: Choose a land type. Remove from play all lands of that type that you control. Drop those cards, one at a time, onto the playing area from a height of at least one foot. Destroy each card in play that is completely covered by those cards. Then return to play, tapped, all lands dropped in this way.

cards.name: Ricochet
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell that targets a single player, each player rolls a six-sided die. Change the target of that spell to the player with the lowest result. Reroll to break ties, if necessary.
cards.originalText: Whenever any spell targets a single player, each player rolls a six-sided die. That spell is redirected to the player or players with the lowest die roll. If two or more players tie for the lowest die roll, they reroll until there is no tie.

cards.name: Spark Fiend
cards.text:
When Spark Fiend enters the battlefield, roll two six-sided dice. If you rolled 2, 3, or 12, sacrifice Spark Fiend. If you rolled 7 or 11, don't roll dice for Spark Fiend during any of your following upkeeps. If you rolled any other total, note that total.
At the beginning of your upkeep, roll two six-sided dice. If you rolled 7, sacrifice Spark Fiend. If you roll the noted total, don't roll dice for Spark Fiend during any of your following upkeeps. Otherwise, do nothing.
cards.originalText:
When Spark Fiend comes into play, roll two six-sided dice. On a total of 2, 3, or 12, sacrifice Spark Fiend. On a total of 7 or 11, do not roll dice for Spark Fiend during any of your following upkeep phases. If you roll any other total, note it.
During your upkeep, roll two six-sided dice. On a total of 7, sacrifice Spark Fiend. If you roll the noted total, do not roll dice for Spark Fiend during any of your following upkeep phases. On any other roll, there is no effect.

cards.name: Strategy, Schmategy
cards.text:
Roll a six-sided die. Strategy, Schmategy has the indicated effect.
1 — Do nothing.
2 — Destroy all artifacts.
3 — Destroy all lands.
4 — Strategy, Schmategy deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
5 — Each player discards their hand and draws seven cards.
6 — Repeat this process two more times.
cards.originalText:
Roll a six-sided die for Strategy, Schmategy. On a 1, Strategy, Schmategy has no effect. Otherwise, it has one of the following effects.
2 Destroy all artifacts.
3 Destroy all lands.
4 Strategy, Schmategy deals 3 damage to each creature and player.
5 Each player discards his or her hand and draws seven cards. 
6 Roll the die two more times.

cards.name: The Ultimate Nightmare of Wizards of the Coast® Customer Service
cards.text: The Ultimate Nightmare of Wizards of the Coast® Customer Service deals X damage to each of Y target creatures and Z target players or planeswalkers.
cards.flavor: The number printed on the card is no longer in service. For help, go to wizards.custhelp.com or find us on Twitter @Wizards_Help.
cards.originalText: The Ultimate Nightmare of Wizards of the Coast® Customer Service deals X damage to each of Y target creatures and Z target players.

cards.name: Cardboard Carapace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
For each other card named Cardboard Carapace you have with you outside the game, enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
cards.flavor: . . .  that exciting  . . .  about  . . .
cards.originalText:
For each other Cardboard Carapace card you have with you, enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Errata: This does not count any Cardboard Carapace cards in play that you control or in your graveyard, hand, or library.

cards.name: Double Play
cards.text: Choose another player. Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. At the beginning of the first upkeep in your next game with that player, search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The wizard exclaimed, "I'm no chicken . . . ."
cards.originalText: Choose another player. Search your library for a basic land and put that land into play. At the beginning of the next game with that player, search your library for an additional basic land and put that land into play. In both cases, shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Elvish Impersonators
cards.text: As Elvish Impersonators enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die twice. Its base power becomes the first result and its base toughness becomes the second result.
cards.flavor: "Uh-hunh."
cards.originalText: When you play Elvish Impersonators, roll two six-sided dice one after the other. Elvish Impersonators comes into play with power equal to the first die roll and toughness equal to the second.

cards.name: Flock of Rabid Sheep
cards.text: Flip X coins. For each flip you win, create a 2/2 green Sheep creature token named Rabid Sheep.
cards.flavor: And their bleating was like a wet salmon slapped upon the land—slap! slap! slap!
cards.originalText: Flip X coins; an opponent calls heads or tails. For each flip you win, put a Rabid Sheep token into play. Treat these tokens as 2/2 green creatures that count as Sheep.

cards.name: Free-Range Chicken
cards.text: {1}{G}: Roll two six-sided dice. If both results are the same, Free-Range Chicken gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that result. If  the total of those results is equal to any other total you have rolled this turn for Free-Range Chicken, sacrifice it. (For example, if you roll two 3s, Free-Range Chicken gets +3/+3. If you roll a total of 6 for Free-Range Chicken later that turn, sacrifice it.)
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Roll two six-sided dice. If both die rolls are the same, Free-Range Chicken gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number rolled on each die. Otherwise, if the total rolled is equal to any other total you have rolled this turn for Free-Range Chicken, sacrifice it. (For example, if you roll two 3s, Free-Range Chicken gets +3/+3. If you roll a total of 6 for Free-Range Chicken later in that turn, sacrifice it.)

cards.name: Gerrymandering
cards.text: Exile all lands. Give each player a number of those cards chosen at random equal to the number of those cards the player controlled. Each player returns those cards to the battlefield under their control.
cards.originalText: Remove all lands from play and shuffle them together. Randomly deal to each player one land card for each land he or she had before. Each player puts those lands into play under his or her control, untapped.

cards.name: Ghazbán Ogress
cards.text: When Ghazbán Ogress enters the battlefield, if one player has won more Magic games that day than any other player, that player gains control of Ghazbán Ogress.
cards.originalText: When Ghazbán Ogress comes into play, the player who has won the most Magic games that day gains control of it. If more than one player has won the same number of games, you retain control of Ghazbán Ogress.

cards.name: Growth Spurt
cards.text: Roll a six-sided die. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the result.
cards.flavor:
MORE TO LOVE: Friendly, nature-loving, Bunyonesque SEM seeks SEF looking for a huge commitment.
. . .  seeks atog prince
cards.originalText: Roll a six-sided die. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is equal to the die roll.

cards.name: Gus
cards.text: Gus enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each Magic game you have lost to one of your opponents since you last won a game against them.
cards.flavor: "Now I lay me down to sleep — What are you starin' at?"
cards.originalText: Gus comes into play with one +1/+1 counter on it for each game you have lost to your opponent since you last won a Magic game against him or her.

cards.name: Hungry Hungry Heifer
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a counter from a permanent you control. If you don't, sacrifice Hungry Hungry Heifer.
cards.flavor: Mooo.
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, remove a counter from any card you control or sacrifice Hungry Hungry Heifer.

cards.name: Incoming!
cards.text: Each player searches their library for any number of artifact, creature, enchantment, and/or land cards, puts them onto the battlefield, then shuffles their library.
cards.originalText: Each player searches his or her library for any number of artifacts, creatures, enchantments, and lands and puts those cards into play. Each player shuffles his or her library afterwards.

cards.name: Mine, Mine, Mine!
cards.text:
When Mine, Mine, Mine enters the battlefield, each player puts their library into their hand.
Players have no maximum hand size and don't lose the game for drawing from an empty library.
Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
When Mine, Mine, Mine leaves the battlefield, each player shuffles their hand and graveyard into their library.
cards.originalText:
When Mine, Mine, Mine comes into play, each player puts his or her library into his or her hand.
Each player skips his or her discard phase and does not lose as a result of being unable to draw a card.
Each player cannot play more than one spell each turn.
If Mine, Mine, Mine leaves play, each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library.

cards.name: Squirrel Farm
cards.text: {1}{G}: Reveal a card in your hand, covering the artist credit. Target opponent guesses the artist. If they guess wrong, create a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token.
cards.flavor:
"And the ignorant shall fall to the squirrels."
—Chip 2:54
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Choose a card in your hand. Covering the artist's name, reveal the card to target player. If that player cannot name the artist, reveal the artist's name and put a Squirrel token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 green creature.

cards.name: Team Spirit
cards.text: Creatures target player's team controls get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Due to some late-night partying, the chicken missed the group photo.
cards.originalText: All creatures controlled by target player and his or her teammates get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Timmy, Power Gamer
cards.text: {4}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Just wait till I get my Leviathan . . . ."
cards.originalText: {4}: Put a creature into play from your hand.

cards.name: Ashnod's Coupon
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Coupon: Target player gets you target drink. You pay any costs for the drink.
cards.flavor: Limited time offer. Void where prohibited. Limit one per purchase. Valid only in participating duels. This coupon is nontransferable and invalid if shattered, crumbled, detonated, pillaged, or otherwise disenchanted. Cash value less than 1/20 of a cent. Offer not valid in Quebec, Rhode Island, or where prohibited by law or the DCI.
cards.originalText:
{T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Coupon: Target player gets you target drink.
Errata: You pay any costs for the drink.

cards.name: Blacker Lotus
cards.text: {T}: Tear Blacker Lotus into pieces. Add four mana of any one color. Remove the pieces from the game.
cards.originalText: {T}: Tear Blacker Lotus into pieces. Add four mana of any one color to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source. Remove the pieces from the game afterwards.

cards.name: Bronze Calendar
cards.text:
Spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
You must speak in a voice other than your normal voice.
When you speak in your normal voice, sacrifice Bronze Calendar.
cards.flavor: Every page holds a month, every date a numeral.
cards.originalText:
Your spells cost {1} less to play as long as you speak in a voice other than your normal voice.
If you speak in your normal voice, sacrifice Bronze Calendar.

cards.name: Chaos Confetti
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Tear Chaos Confetti into pieces. Throw the pieces onto the battlefield from a distance of at least five feet. Destroy each permanent that a piece touches. Remove the pieces from the game.
cards.flavor: And you thought that was just an urban legend.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Tear Chaos Confetti into pieces. Throw the pieces onto the playing area from a distance of at least five feet. Destroy each card in play that a piece touches. Remove the pieces from the game afterwards.

cards.name: Clay Pigeon
cards.text:
Flying
{1}, Throw Clay Pigeon into the air at least two feet above your head while seated: If you catch Clay Pigeon with one hand, prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal to you this turn and tap Clay Pigeon. Otherwise, sacrifice it.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}, Throw Clay Pigeon into the air at least two feet above your head while seated, Attempt to catch it with one hand: If you catch Clay Pigeon, prevent all damage to you from any one source and return Clay Pigeon to play, tapped. Otherwise, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Giant Fan
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Move a counter from one permanent onto another. If the second permanent refers to any kind of counter, the moved counter becomes one of those counters. Otherwise, it becomes a +1/+1 counter.
cards.flavor: Only a villain would unleash a giant fan on anyone!
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Move target counter from one card to another. If the second card's rules text refers to any type of counters, the moved counter becomes one of those counters. Otherwise, it becomes a +1/+1 counter.

cards.name: Jack-in-the-Mox
cards.text:
{T}: Roll a six-sided die. This ability has the indicated effect.
1 — Sacrifice Jack-in-the-Mox and you lose 5 life.
2 — Add {W}.
3 — Add {U}.
4 — Add {B}.
5 — Add {R}.
6 — Add {G}.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Roll a six-sided die for Jack-in-the-Mox. On a 1, sacrifice Jack-in-the-Mox and lose 5 life. Otherwise, Jack-in-the-Mox has one of the following effects. Treat this ability as a mana source.
2 Add {W} to your mana pool.
3 Add {U} to your mana pool.
4 Add {B} to your mana pool.
5 Add {R} to your mana pool.
6 Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Jester's Sombrero
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Sombrero: Look at target player's sideboard, choose three cards from it, and remove those cards from the match.
cards.flavor: "¡Yo quiero Kormus Bell!"
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Sombrero: Look through target player's sideboard and remove any three of those cards from it for the remainder of the match.

cards.name: Mirror Mirror
cards.text:
Mirror Mirror enters the battlefield tapped.
{7}, {T}, Sacrifice Mirror Mirror: Choose target player. At the beginning of the next end step, exchange life totals with that player, exchange control of all permanents you and that player control, and exchange cards in your hands, cards in your libraries, and cards in your graveyards.
cards.originalText:
Mirror Mirror comes into play tapped.
{7}, {T}, Sacrifice Mirror Mirror: At end of turn, exchange life totals with target player and exchange all cards in play that you control, and all cards in your hand, library, and graveyard, with that player until end of game.

cards.name: Paper Tiger
cards.text: Creatures named Rock Lobster can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: The tiger is always quick to fold.
cards.originalText: Rock Lobsters cannot attack or block.

cards.name: Rock Lobster
cards.text: Creatures named Scissors Lizard can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: Many take the lobster for granite.
cards.originalText: Scissors Lizards cannot attack or block.

cards.name: Scissors Lizard
cards.text: Creatures named Paper Tiger can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: Nothing beats the lizard's shear power.
cards.originalText: Paper Tigers cannot attack or block.

cards.name: Spatula of the Ages
cards.text: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice Spatula of the Ages: You may put a silver-bordered permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
At last Urza's powers were focused through the incredible artifact.
"Who wants pancakes?" he asked.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice Spatula of the Ages: Put into play from your hand any card from an Unglued supplement.

cards.name: Urza's Contact Lenses
cards.text:
Urza's Contact Lenses enters the battlefield tapped.
Urza's Contact Lenses doesn't untap during your untap step.
As long as Urza's Contact Lenses is untapped, all players play with their hands revealed.
Clap your hands twice: You may tap or untap Urza's Contact Lenses.
cards.originalText:
Urza's Contact Lenses comes into play tapped and does not untap during its controller's untap phase.
All players play with their hands face up.
Clap your hands twice: Tap or untap Urza's Contact Lenses.

cards.name: Urza's Science Fair Project
cards.text:
{2}: Roll a six-sided die. Urza's Science Fair Project gets the indicated result.
1 — It gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
2 — Prevent all combat damage it would deal this turn.
3 — It gains vigilance until end of turn.
4 — It gains first strike until end of turn.
5 — It gains flying until end of turn.
6 — It gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{2}: Roll a six-sided die for Urza's Science Fair Project.
1 It gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
2 It deals no combat damage this turn.
3 Attacking does not cause it to tap this turn.
4 It gains first strike until end of turn.
5 It gains flying until end of turn.
6 It gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Plains
cards.originalText: W
